DataElement.preferredName: Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite 5 Past 4 Weeks How Many Pads or Adult Diapers per Day Did You Use to Control Leakage Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation in the past 4 weeks how many pads or adult diapers per day did they use to control leakage, using a 4 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite Past 4 Weeks How Many Pads or Adult Diapers per Day Did You Use to Control Leakage Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to evaluate patient function and bother after prostate cancer treatment._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how many pads or adult diapers an individual used each day to control leakage._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to evaluate patient function and bother after prostate cancer treatment.

Concepts.definition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to evaluate patient function and bother after prostate cancer treatment.

Property.preferredName: Past 4 Weeks How Many Pads or Adult Diapers per Day Did You Use to Control Leakage Score

A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: EPIC Daily Pad Use 4 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard related to the use per day of adult diapers or pads to control urine leakage associated with the EPIC measure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used one absorbent pad per day.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used one absorbent pad per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used two absorbent pads per day.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used two absorbent pads per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used three absorbent pads per day.

Concepts.longName: Three or More Pads per Day
Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual uses or used three or more absorbent pads per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual did not use any absorbent pads per day.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual did not use any absorbent pads per day.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemeItems.longName: CTEP CDISC EPIC-26 Short Form (Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite-26)

ReferenceDocuments.name: How many pads or adult diaper
ReferenceDocuments.description: How many pads or adult diapers per day did you usually use to control leakage during the last 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
